conclusion: Starting from each opening, consider which sloping bar (baffle) is struck first and the direction it sends the stream.
The stream meets the next row of baffles and is deflected again, determining if it ends up left or right of the middle divider.
After two or three deflections, the liquid's horizontal position is clearly either to the left of the middle divider (drops into trough E) or to the right (drops into trough F).
Opening A is pushed right by the first yellow bar, then pushed left by the next gray bar and ends up left of center, leading to container E.
Opening B is pushed right by the yellow bar and never crosses back to the left side, leading to container F.
Opening C lands on the orange bar which pushes it left, but the white bar below pushes it right again, so it stays on the right side, leading to container F.
Opening D starts on the far right, remains to the right of every baffle and never crosses the divider, leading to container F.
Liquid from A enters container E.
Liquid from B enters container F.
Liquid from C enters container F.
Liquid from D enters container F.
